channel.title: For those of you who dont know
channel.description:
SRL is going down.. http://www.villavu.com/forums/showthread.php?t=2588
farewell Fakawi
This means we might be getting more traffic at these forums eh mopar?
So what now? Who's next? First kaitnieks then SRL are we gonners too? Dont die on us mopar!
[b]A few words from a former SCAR scripter Sqig.[/b]
< - - Squigglyo - - > says: [b]The cheating world cannot live with only a few leaders, there needs to be some sort of system worked out with much more people in charge.[/b] |[ﷲ]|{-яλмєєż-}--{- ЄλÅ¡ŧ Şұđє-}-SHUT UP!!! I'm trying to listen to the SILENCE!!!! says: [b]hmm[/b] < - - Squigglyo - - > says: [b]Every community, no matter how big, has been taken down mostly due to threats, but if there is no main leader, but many leaders, that cant happen, and then even if some go, theres many more to continue.[/b]
For more information visit http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=6001.0

item.description:
@aznph8playa wrote:

moparisthebest:

kaitnieks like this community only allowed the selling of SCAR scripts, and nothing else

Ah ok, thanks for the clarification. Regardless, I don’t feel that black markets cause any kind of malice in a community as long as the group running the market maintains some sort of check on its members whether it be banning for those who attempt to scam or monitoring the trades =o)

item.source: For those of you who dont know

item.title: For those of you who dont know
item.dc:creator: @aznph8playa aznph8playa
item.description:
@aznph8playa wrote:

[quote=“Vipsta, post:19, topic:4599”]In reference to Sqigs comments:

I think you’re wrong. The people who become head of forums these days are mostly newbies. Obviously Fakawi, mopar, and maybe Sythe are the exceptions, the majority of administrators at websites like Dodian, rs2cheating, and RS-Server are all retards. Their newbies when it comes to RS Cheating. They become leaders because they pay the server bills (and bitch about it, at that!). They also are relatively new to the scene, and probably never played RSClassic, let alone experience the golden days of cheating. Those were the days of RuneBot, AutoRune, and towards the end of RSC’s life, the bot clones (When everyone had a bot source and was autoing).

These type of people that have become leaders dwell too much in RS stuff. They run black markets which cause scamming, greed, and hate. All of which destroy communities and pin cheaters against cheaters. That is probably why the community is so seperated now. Granted, the seperation makes us harder to kill, but it also makes it harder to create longstanding cheats.[/quote]

I suppose I agree to some extent that the large number of communities out there has fueled some distrust between individual communities however I don’t think that has much to do with the blackmarkets that have been run in those communities. One would say that the selling of bots and scripts is in itself a form of a black market, however, it has very few of the implications that you have mentioned. If I’m not mistaken, Scythe and Kaitnieks allowed sales of items other than bots as well and there were few adverse effects.

Regardless, something that really causes seperation in the communities is the lack of open source code. There are so many powerful scripters out there that are very helpful to the newer fellows who are trying to rise up. I myself am trying to learn a little bit about java and have pmed a number of the more well known scripters with short discrete messages but have yet to gain a simple reply such as a hello or how are you. I’d hope that they would take the initiative to help the upcoming programmers and strengthen the community, especially as seeing that a majority of them are moderators or administrators.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Vipsta Vipsta
item.description:
@Vipsta wrote:

In reference to Sqigs comments:

I think you’re wrong. The people who become head of forums these days are mostly newbies. Obviously Fakawi, mopar, and maybe Sythe are the exceptions, the majority of administrators at websites like Dodian, rs2cheating, and RS-Server are all retards. Their newbies when it comes to RS Cheating. They become leaders because they pay the server bills (and bitch about it, at that!). They also are relatively new to the scene, and probably never played RSClassic, let alone experience the golden days of cheating. Those were the days of RuneBot, AutoRune, and towards the end of RSC’s life, the bot clones (When everyone had a bot source and was autoing).

These type of people that have become leaders dwell too much in RS stuff. They run black markets which cause scamming, greed, and hate. All of which destroy communities and pin cheaters against cheaters. That is probably why the community is so seperated now. Granted, the seperation makes us harder to kill, but it also makes it harder to create longstanding cheats.
